text: [no audio]
no audio
alright lets just right in
as far as announcements go, for deadlines we've got mp_parse.2 tomorrow at 11, we've got lab_trees tonight at 11
lab_heaps which is the lab you'll start today will be due sat at 11
mp_parse.3 will be due monday at 11
so all sort of standard assignment deadlines going on
there will be a prelecture for monday so make sure you go on moodle and do the prelecture for monday
the second exam is wednesday from 7-9, im working on room assignments, sort of waiting for to know exactly how many rooms i need for that
so those will be announced next week
practice problems will go up today, im just drowning under all the things i have to get done so i haven't had a chance to put them up yet
again, same story as last time will apply so there will be things on those exams that we have not covered yet, dont panic only look at the problems for which i've assigned.
we cover things in a slightly different order so there will be stuff from all over the place.
there will be like a final, there will some midterm 3's or midterm 2's or 1's
so, there's going to be problems all over the board, but just do the ones that ive suggested and you should be ok

the topics for this are on the website, but generally speaking, we will cover.. lists.. stacks.. queues.. prority queues.. trees and the last priority queue implementation that we will talk about today and the lab which are the heaps
so likely, we will finish up the content for wednesday's exam on monday
because there is one big proof that i want to do that we will not get to today
right, so, in lab today you will be receiving exam one, ok.
i have no statistics yet, because they are not in yet
we are right down to the wire, they are going in right now
so probably in the little bit before lab im going to be inputting those
so i do need to kind of jet after lecture today, so im not going to stick around until 12.
im going to leave out of here no later than 11:30 so i can get that input.
when you get your exam back, step one, dont panic.
step two, check that your grade is correct in the grade book.
step 3, go over your exam and ensure that you do not want to make a regrade request.
if you want to make a regrade request it must be submitted in lab where you receive the exam.
if you leave the lab section with your exam you forfeit your right to a regrade. you can thank silly people in the past for that
so if you have a regrade request you need to make it in the same lab section that you received your exam in.
so if you're not sure if you should submit a regrade request or not, talk to the lab ta's and they should give you an idea as to whether or not there might be something there.

as a reminder, as per the sylabus, if you submit a regrade request, i will regrade the entire exam from scratch myself, so if you're looking to get like one point back, and its not really that clear that you get that one point back, it might not be a good idea

that being said, if we screwed up, let us know that we screwed up and we'll go over the whole exam because i was probably asleep while grading and i was up until like, midnight doing these things and i know that Conica was up even later than that
so there are bound to be a few mistakes and well find those and fix them
but if you have a legitimate regrade request be away that i will regrade the whole thing from scratch, so dont just submit things trying to grub for points because thats not going to work so well

i am going to try to set up a exam post mortem for this exam so that is.. i can go into a room and do the exam in two hours and show you that it can be done in two hours and sort of talk about the common errors and sort of what the points in the rubric were.
I haven't had a chance to secure a room for that yet, my goal is for that to be maybe some time on sunday, like 3-5 or something
but i need to actually get a room and i haven't done that yet, so once i know for sure that we have a room, and we have a location ill post them in piazza and spam blast everybody
and you can go to that if you're curious what a gold standard would look like for the exam if you want
every lab section before the exam will be review, so next Tuesday lab will be a review session.
so again, come to that prepared with questions that you're not sure about, or exam practice questions that you want the lab ta's to go over with you
im not going to ask them to prepare any review material, if they do great, if they dont, whatever, i dont care, so it's your job to come prepared with things that you're not sure about.

as a reminder, not an announcement my DYB is always going to be from 3-5 on fridays and it's in the calander as a repeating event. so if you have questions about what will be covered in lecture, last week, or this week, or ever, please come to that.
i wont debug your MP for you but i may talk conceptual issues if you dont understand what you're supposed to do. that sort of stuff, but im not going to debug segfaults
because i dont have a machine, im just a white board. those are always going to be in the basement lobby of siebel, sort of where all those tables are and the whiteboards, ill be there

so, there, i got some good feedback in prelectures about some you know, some issues with queue depth in office hours, ive made some changes to try and remedy that, please see the announcement on piazza. You should have gotten a spam blast email about that as well

so please look at that, be away of the minor policy changes for office hours. my goal with that isn't to, you know, eliminate your quality time with the TA's, my goal for that is to ensure that that quality time is equally spread out among all students
